column4: Hey all... is KUBUNTU less stable than UBUNTU?
kde 4 is a little new, otherwise gnome and kde are a preferance issue
if you got kde ubuntu and its real new then its still a beta release of kubuntu
im not sure if i correctly understand your predicament
can you tell us what version you got , 8.04 or hardy heron , or was it 7.10 gutsy gibbon
depending on what its called an exsample would be: sudo mount /dev/sda /mnt/sda
sd A: defines the disk or device : 1 defines the partition to mount. it could also be sdb 1 or sdc 1 or 2 or 3
thats your fstab , or boot junk
would one of them be the name of my usb external harddrive?
i will assume you have one internal hard drive. in this case your external hard drive is sdb1
